org.github.terminological.roogledocs

Class RoogleDocs

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.github.terminological.roogledocs.RoogleDocs

  • public class RoogleDocs
extends Object
    Programmatically substitute images, data and tables into a google doc. R library to perform limited interactions with google docs (and maybe one day slides) in R via the Java API library. The purpose being to support google docs as a platform for interactive development and documentation of data analysis in R for scientific publication, although it is not limited to this purpose. The workflow supported is a parallel documentation and analysis where a team of people are working collaboratively on documentation, whilst at the same time analysis is being performed and results updated repeatedly as a result of new data. In this environment updating numeric results, tabular data and figures in word documents manually becomes annoying. With roogledocs you can automate this a bit like a RMarkdown document, but with the added benefit that the content can be updated independently of the analysis, by the wider team.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoogleDocs

        public RoogleDocs(String tokenDirectory,
                  boolean disabled)
           throws IOException,
                  GeneralSecurityException
        Parameters:
        tokenDirectory - the place to store authentication tokens. This should not be checked into version control.
        disabled - a flag to switch roogledocs off (on a document by document basis, for testing or development. This can be set globally with `options('roogledocs.disabled'=TRUE)`
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem storing the tokens or communicating with google servers
        GeneralSecurityException - if there is a problem authenticating

    • Method Detail

      • reauth

        public RoogleDocs reauth()
                  throws IOException,
                         GeneralSecurityException
        Reauthenticate the service deleting the existing OAuth tokens. Generally this would only be needed if application permission updates are needed in which case the directory can be manually deleted anyway, or if you want to switch google user without using a different tokenDirectory.
        Returns:
        a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem deleting the old tokens
        GeneralSecurityException - if there is a problem authenticating

      • enable

        public RoogleDocs enable()
                  throws IOException,
                         GeneralSecurityException
        Enables roogledocs. It is likely one of `withDocument()`, `findOrCreateDocument()` or `findOrCloneTemplate()` methods will be needed to specify the document.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException - if the client cannot authenticate
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • disable

        public RoogleDocs disable()
        disables roogledocs temporarily only for this document. While disabled all calls to roogledocs will silently fail.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method

      • withDocument

        public RoogleDocs withDocument(String shareUrlOrDocId)
                        throws IOException
        Select a document by its share url or id.
        Parameters:
        shareUrlOrDocId - the url from clicking a share button in google docs or an id from searchForDocuments() method
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • findOrCreateDocument

        public RoogleDocs findOrCreateDocument(String title)
                                throws IOException
        Search for or create a document if it is missing.
        Parameters:
        title - a document title. If there is an exact match in google drive then that document will be used otherwise a new one will be created.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • findOrCloneTemplate

        public RoogleDocs findOrCloneTemplate(String title,
                                      String templateUri)
                               throws IOException
        Search for or create a document as a copy of a template document if it is missing.
        Parameters:
        title - a document title. If there is an exact match in google drive then that document will be used otherwise a new one will be created.
        templateUri - the share link (or document id) of a template google document
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or the template uri is not correct

      • searchForDocuments

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe searchForDocuments(String titleMatch)
                                                               throws IOException
        Search for documents with the given title
        Parameters:
        titleMatch - a string to be searched for as an approximate match. All results will be retrieved with document ids.
        Returns:
        a dataframe containing "id" and "name" columns
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • tagsDefined

        public uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe tagsDefined()
                                                        throws IOException
        Finds tags defined in the current document
        Returns:
        a dataframe containing "tag" and "count" columns
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or the text is blank

      • updateTaggedText

        public RoogleDocs updateTaggedText(String text,
                                   String tagName)
                            throws IOException
        Substitutes all occurrences of {{tag-name}} with the text parameter.
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name
        text - the value to replace the tag with (e.g. a result from analysis) (cannot be empty)
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • updateTaggedImage

        public RoogleDocs updateTaggedImage(String absoluteFilePath,
                                    String tagName,
                                    double dpi)
                             throws IOException
        Substitutes all occurrences of {{tag-name}} with an image from the local storage. There are limited circumstances in which using this is a good idea. It will almost always be better to use `updateFigure()` to insert an image by index. If you choose to ignore this warning, beware combining this with `updateFigure()` as potentially the figure indexes will change dynamically. You have been warned.
        Parameters:
        tagName - the tag name
        absoluteFilePath - a file path to an png image file.
        dpi - the dots per inch of the image in the document (defaults to 300)
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or there is a problem loading the image file

      • getImageDim

        protected static com.google.api.services.docs.v1.model.Size getImageDim(String path,
                                                                        double dpi)
                                                                 throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • revertTags

        public RoogleDocs revertTags()
                      throws IOException
        remove all tagged text and images inserted by roogledocs and returns the bare document. This does not affect figures and tables inserted by index (i.e. without tags) This is needed if content is being moved around as cut and paste of tagged content unfortunately removes the internal named range of the tag.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers

      • updateTable

        public RoogleDocs updateTable(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe longFormatTable,
                              int tableIndex,
                              uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumericVector colWidths,
                              uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RNumeric tableWidthInches)
                       throws IOException,
                              uk.co.terminological.rjava.UnconvertableTypeException
        Update or insert a formatted table into the document. The table and formatting are described in a dataframe the format of which is documented in the as.long_format_table() method.
        Parameters:
        tableIndex - what is the table index in the document? This can be left out for a new table at the end of the document.
        longFormatTable - A dataframe consisting of the table content and formatting indexed by row and column. at a minimum this should have columns label,row,col, but may also include rowSpan,colSpan,fillColour, leftBorderWeight, rightBorderWeight, topBorderWeight, bottomBorderWeight, alignment (START,CENTER,END), valignment (TOP,MIDDLE,BOTTOM), fontName, fontFace, fontSize.
        colWidths - A vector including the relative length of each column. This can be left out if longFormatTable comes from as.long_format_table
        tableWidthInches - The final width of the table in inches (defaults to a size that fits in A4 page with margins)
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers
        uk.co.terminological.rjava.UnconvertableTypeException - if the longFormatTable data frame is the wrong format.

      • updateFigure

        public RoogleDocs updateFigure(String absoluteFilePath,
                               int figureIndex,
                               double dpi)
                        throws IOException
        Update or insert a figure in the document.
        Parameters:
        figureIndex - what is the figure index in the document? (This only counts inline images - and ignores absolutely positioned ones). leave out for a new image at the end of the document.
        absoluteFilePath - a file path to an png image file (only png is supported at this point).
        dpi - the dots per inch of the image in the document (defaults to 300). the final size of the image in the doc will be determined by the image file dimensions and the dpi.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or the png file cannot be read.

      • saveAsPdf

        public RoogleDocs saveAsPdf(String absoluteFilePath)
                     throws IOException
        Saves a snapshot of the current google doc as a pdf to a local drive. This is mainly intended for testing.
        Parameters:
        absoluteFilePath - - a file path to save the pdf.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or the file cannot be saved.

      • deleteDocument

        public RoogleDocs deleteDocument(String docName,
                                 boolean areYouSure)
                          throws IOException
        Deletes a google document by name.
        Parameters:
        docName - - the name of a document to delete. must be an exact and unique match.
        areYouSure - - a boolean check.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers, or the file cannot be saved.

      • appendText

        public RoogleDocs appendText(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RCharacter text,
                             uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RCharacter style)
                      throws IOException
        Append text to the document with optional paragraph styling. If you run text blocks into each other without newlines the whole resulting paragraph will be styled. You would normally not want this so it is up to you to end paragraphs with a new line character, before changing styles.
        Parameters:
        text - - a single string with the text to append which may include newlines
        style - - one of NORMAL_TEXT, TITLE, SUBTITLE, HEADING_1, ... HEADING_6
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers.

      • appendFormattedParagraph

        public RoogleDocs appendFormattedParagraph(uk.co.terminological.rjava.types.RDataframe formattedTextDf)
                                    throws IOException,
                                           uk.co.terminological.rjava.UnconvertableTypeException
        Append a new paragraph, with text from the 'label' column with optional formating in the other columns.
        Parameters:
        formattedTextDf - - a data frame containing the columns label, and optionally: link (as a URL), fontName, fontFace, fontSize.
        Returns:
        itself - a fluent method
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with google servers.
        uk.co.terminological.rjava.UnconvertableTypeException - if the dataframe format is not correct
